channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.title: [Go] Standard Input
item.description: Store successive space-separated values into successive arguments: import "fmt" var arg1, arg2 string n, _ := fmt.Scanln(&arg1, &arg2) fmt.Printf("n: %d, arg1: %s, arg2: %s\n", n, arg1, arg2) $ go run . Input: -a -b n: 2, arg1: -a, arg2: -b

item.title: [Go] Resources
item.description: Why Go Go Code Review Comments Ultimate Go study guide

item.title: [Go] Command Line Arguments
item.description: import "os" os.Args (type: []string) hold the command-line arguments, starting with the program name. Program name: os.Args[0] List of arguments: os.Args[1:] Number of arguments: len(os.Args[1:] Convert the argument from string to integer: import "strconv" num, err := strconv.Atoi(os.Args[1])
